intro: Microstaphyla furcata, commonly known as the forked microstaphyla, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge. Microstaphyla furcata is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands.
